conclusion: The car A drives in from the group of blocks on the right, and the task is to determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
The car A is positioned on the right side of the image, heading leftward toward a group of blocks. The blocks include various colors: light-blue, orange, bright-green, yellow, red, and purple.

The blocks are arranged in a scattered pattern, with the light-blue block closest to the car's path, followed by an orange block slightly above and behind it, and a larger bright-green block farther along the same line of travel.
The car enters on an essentially straight, left-ward path.
The light-blue cube is the first obstacle on the car's line of travel; it is light, so the car pushes it aside with almost no deflection.
Immediately afterward, the orange cube is encountered; it is light, so the car still keeps roughly the same heading, though now with noticeably less speed.
The next body on the car's line of travel is the heavier green cube; the car’s remaining kinetic energy is insufficient to move it much, so the car’s motion is finally arrested there.
The car ends up losing the last of its speed against the face of the large green cube and remains there; the two small cubes have been nudged a short distance ahead of it.
The cubes that are struck by the car are: the small light-blue cube, the small orange cube, and the larger bright-green cube.
